name: Bottle Stopper and Corkscrew Combined
description:
The combi bottle stopper and corkscrew comes in two styles. There is the "T-bar" (pictured) and "Gear Knob."

The T-Bar is highly functional allowing greater pulling purchase on the cork, whilst the Gear Knob is prettier looking in the bottle!

Both are fashioned from sustainable hardwoods (Oak, Yew, Laburnum, Rosinga, African Blackwood and Leadwood) and feature the concealed corkscrew and bottle stopper. These are superior to cork types as they benefit from stainless steel and hard wearing rubber sealing rings.

name: Parker Bullet Pen
description:
Hand turned, your very own hiring and firing pen!

Having Parker inserts and mechanisms these pens ooze quality throughout. These are much more a jacket pen than their big brothers the machine gun pens. Like them they are unique, turned by hand, sanded and polished. They are available in silver and gold finishes, both come with the copper style "bullet", and are presented in velvet pouch.

The pen cap has cartridge markings and the clip is shaped as a rifle.

Available in a range of sustainable hardwoods - Oak, Yew, African Black Wood, Rosinga and Leadwood.

A must for service personnel or anyone into their guns!

name: Machine Gun Pen
description:
Fashioned from a used .5 inch machine gun shell, your very own hiring and firing pen!

Hand turned, sanded, polished and finished. These are individual and unique. Changeable and easily available inserts "cross type" (Smiths, Stapes etc) and presented in a velvet pouch.   

Available in a range of sustainable hardwoods - Oak, Yew, African Black Wood, Rosinga and Leadwood.

name: Piston Clock
description:
Taken from the dying heart of a two litre Ford Transit engine and up-cycled into desk art! 

This piston and con-rod have had a hard working life delivering power. Their retirement is to while away the hours making sure you are up to the minute, up to date. 

Hand polished and crafted each clock has unique markings to the piston base.
